content:
s that actually exist.
In our legal system, there are three main sources of the law: statutes, the
Constitution, and precedents.
STATUTES.Roughly,  statutes  are  general  rules  of  law  passed  by  legisla-
tures. Statutes are made at various levels (federal, state, and local), and they
cover various subjects, including crimes as well as property, contracts, and
other areas of civil law. There are also statutes governing the procedures and
kinds of evidence that can be presented in court.
